author: tsuigeo
content: Hello - donno if this is the right place - but i've a general question about the promise of the "social layer" on top of consensus to as an emergency to defend against catastrophic forks. How does it work to protect against censorship with say a OFAC geth fork if real-asset-backed applications such as USDC decide to side with OFAC geth essentially making USDC worthless on any other fork, even a majority socially agreed upon one, aside from the OFAC approved chain. isnt this a serious weak link in censorship resistance? Whats the solution here?

author: doss0276
content: gm, i have a question about how the first POS block is going to be built, please tell me what I got wrong, first a block with diff > TDD (is it >= or > ?) will be minted, then some validator at the begining of their slot (max 13 cuz we could of hit TDD 1 milli secs post the start of the last slot) will ask their EC if TDD has been met, if so it will tell the client to construct a block, 4 second later the client will ask the EC for the block and propose it
